wikipedia_page.main: Paul Johnson (born 18 July 1972) is a former professional squash player from England.

Chaloner was a member of the England team which won the World Team Squash Championships in 1995, and reached a career-high world ranking of World No. 7 in 2001. He won a gold medal for England in the men's doubles at the 1998 Commonwealth Games in Kuala Lumpur, (partnering Paul Johnson).<. He was elected President of the Professional Squash Association (PSA) in 2002.

The third group of inductees in 2011 were skier Chemmy Alcott (Richmond), Paralympic swimmer Elaine Barrett (Hackney), triathlete Tim Don (Hounslow), high jumper Dalton Grant (Hackney), squash player Paul Johnson (Greenwich), and footballer Rachel Yankey (Brent).

link_mentions.page: London Youth Games Hall of Fame
response: The 2011 Hall of Fame and Awards Evening took place on Tuesday 20 September at Lord's Cricket Ground. The third batch of inductees consisted of three-time Olympian skier Chemmy Alcott, Paralympic swimming gold medallist Elaine Barrett, world triathlon champion Tim Don, Commonwealth Games gold medallist high jumper Dalton Grant, Commonwealth Games gold medallist squash player Paul Johnson, and superstar Arsenal and England footballer Rachel Yankey.
